DOC.brief_summary: Introduction - A national smoking cessation E-intervention , call Tabac Info Service ( TIS ) , develop France provide adapt web mobile application support smoke cessation adult smoker , without chronic disease , want stop smoking . This paper present study protocol evaluation program . The primary objective evaluation ass efficacy efficacy condition eTIS . The secondary objective 1 ) describe efficacy variation regard user characteristic , 2 ) analyze mechanism efficacy condition eTIS , variation use , social environmental contextual factor likely influence efficacy eTIS , behavior change technique ( BCTs ) . Methods analyse - The study design two-arm pragmatic randomize controlled trial include process evaluation least 3000 participant randomize intervention control arm ( current practice present non-interactive website ) . Inclusion criterion : Adults , Smokers information consent form complete , Getting smartphone use mobile application , want stop smoking short , medium long term . The exclusion criterion refusal participate study . The primary outcome point prevalence abstinence 7 day 6 month later . The secondary outcome : point prevalence abstinence 24 h 3 month later , point prevalence abstinence 30 day 12 month later , number quit attempt study , progression stage within program ( change duration stage ) . Data analyze Intention treat ( main analyze ) per protocol way . A logistic regression carry estimate OR [ 95 % confidence interval ] efficacy . A multivariate multilevel analysis explore influence patient ' characteristic , social environmental context , condition use behavior change technique result . Dissemination -The finding study allow u understand characterize efficacy eTIS , condition efficacy , underlining psychological , sociological , environmental contextual factor , could influence efficacy type intervention smoker . These finding disseminate peer-reviewed journal , national international conference presentation public event .
DOC.brief_title: Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial Evaluating Effectiveness Smoking Cessation e- Intervention `` Tabac Info Service ``
